word: Ellen White recognized that a time of recreation, a break in the routine, was essential to good health. She informed her husband, "I shall ride every day after dinner. My health demands it." (Letter 21, 1876). "I must stop a day or two in the week and go somewhere or my head will break down." (Letter 9, 1876). "I . . . shall take a day now and then for a change, ride or go to Healdsburg, not for their good but my own." (Letter 11, 1876).
